gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Natural Gas, Crude Oil, and Refined Oil Pipelines: Indiana, 2002

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: PIPELINES_IGS_IN depicts the location and extent of known natural gas, crude oil, and refined products pipelines in Indiana. PIPELINES, the predecessor of PIPELINES_IGS_IN, was digitized from data shown on 1:63,360 scale (1 inch = 1 mile) county work maps compiled for the creation of Indiana Geological Survey, Miscellaneous Map 53, Map of Indiana Showing Oil, Gas, and Products Pipelines, by S.J. Keller, 1991, Scale 1:500,000.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: PIPELINES_IGS_IN was created to provide the Indiana Geological Survey and public with a functional digital representation of oil and gas pipeline locations in Indiana for use in geographic information system.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This data set was compiled by Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcView 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 997 Kb

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: PIPELINES was digitized from data shown on 1:63,360 scale (1 inch = 1 mile) county work maps compiled for the creation of Indiana Geological Survey, Miscellaneous Map 53, Map of Indiana Showing Oil, Gas, and Products Pipelines, by S.J. Keller, 1991, Scale 1:500,000. The work maps were scanned using a wide-bed, full-spectrum scanner and the resulting images were georeferenced using ESRI ArcInfo 8.01. The pipelines were then digitized on screen in ESRI ArcView 3.2.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: In some instances, pipelines that are within 0.25 mile of each other AND have the same operator have been depicted as one line. In such cases, the "Pipe_Size" attribute values will include all pipe sizes depicted by a given line.

The attributes associated with the pipelines in this shapefile were transcribed from the line symbology and labels shown on the original paper source maps. Therefore, attribute accuracy of this shapefile is dependent on the accuracy of the original work maps.

This shapefile was digitized from 1:63,360-scale source maps. However, the maps were based on "General Highway and Transportation County Base Maps" compiled in the 1930s to 1950s, that are known to contain sizeable amounts of error. This creates problems when trying to compile a statewide digital dataset for use with other, more accurate base maps in a geographic information system. In cases where multiple county maps would not align properly, pipelines were edge-matched to produce a seamless shapefile devoid of county line offsets. Given the inaccuracy of the source base maps IT SHOULD BE ASSUMED THAT THESE DATA HAVE A HORIZONTAL POSITIONAL ERROR OF + OR - 1/2 MILE. If you need more detailed pipeline location information for a given county, please contact the Indiana Geological Survey for a digital copy of the original county work maps.
The vertical positional accuracy of the paper source maps is unknown. Vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of this dataset. No quantitative tests were performed.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: County Pipeline Work Maps from MM53 were scanned using a full-spectrum wide-bed scanner and the images were saved as .tif files (and later compressed as lower resolution JPEG images). Each image was then georeferenced in ESRI ArcInfo 8.0 using the Register and Rectify commands. For the registration, tics were located at the corners of townships allowing for the most complete and accurate tic placement for each county. Once the images were georeferenced, pipelines were digitized on screen and attributed in ESRI ArcView 3.2.
The shapefile named "PIPELINES" was clipped to INCLP83, a boundary coverage for the State of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). The resulting shapefile was named "PIPELINES_IGS_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
This source provided the location and attribute information for all oil and gas pipelines in Indiana.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: County Pipeline Work Maps for Indiana Geological Survey, Miscellaneous Map 53

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: These county-based work maps depict the locations of known natural gas, crude oil, and refined products pipelines in each of Indiana's 92 counties. The maps are 1:63,360- scale and utilize the old "General Highway and Transportation" base, that is known to contain a significant degree of horizontal spatial error. The work maps were compiled by IGS researchers and updated in 1988 by S.J. Keller for the production of Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 53, Map of Indiana Showing Oil, Gas, and Products Pipelines, 1991, scale 1:500,000. Data on these work maps were compiled from miscellaneous oil and gas company pipeline maps.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Date of most recent map revisions

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
